author: water_jedi_17
title: Plo Koon the rare jedi master
review: Just like Obi-Wan, Plo Koon is another rare character available in an expensive Clone Wars set. But Lego has really made a great job of making Plo Koon unlike Asajj Ventress. Just like Kit Fisto, they both share plastic head pieces. His mask extends a little too low since in Clone wars series, his mask is more larger. But, anyway, his torso contains an interesting weave across his waist, although a few details wouldnâ€™t hurt. Unlike many other character key chains, the two jedi I previously reviewed lack a cape. Is lego cutting back on elements for clone wars characters to get more money than los it? But, although the price of key chains is somewhat expensive, I would recommend this to anybody who wants something to do with their keys, or own a rare mini figure.

author: Joel_Baker
title: Great Detail
review:
Great color and detail. Excellent way to expand your your jedi council if you don't want to buy the Gunship.

Functionality/playability: 5
Just a minifigure, all parts move

Price per piece/rare piece: 5
The Plo Koon parts are only available here and the Gunhsip

Appearrance/details/accuracy: 5
The Rubber head is interesting, I wonder if we will see more of this type of material used in licensed sets

author: Zacherano
title: Great Minifigure Keychain with High Price
review:
Although I do think this is one of the best minifigure key chains, Lego's massive franchise still feels that they are able to overprice key chains that we still want to buy but are disgusted by the price.  We need to rebel against Lego's ridiculous key chain prices.  They are now $5, and they used to be about half that much!
     Now for the actual key chain minifigure, I think it is quite good.  I am glad they make key chains of rare figures like the Jedi Master Plo Koon for the pleasure of using them with our keys.  The minifigure is very enjoyable, with a rubber head similar to that of Jedi Knight Kit Fisto, a fairly detailed torso and unusual leg color, and a helmet that extends over the body.  The only con with the minifigure itself, which is also featured in the "Republic Attack Gunship" and Plo Koon's Jedi Starfighter coming out this summer, is the length of the helmet, which does not extend as long in the actual Clone Wars TV series.  One cannot fault Lego for this minor incongruity, however, as if the helmet were any shorter, the proportions of the minifigure would not be accurate.

     Please keep appreciating Lego's marvelous key chains, but remember to ask for better prices!  :-)

author: jedi_master_kit_fisto
title: good
review: its a good key chain and has some good parts but its not that good to play with.it's all right for the price but it could be a little cheaper. overall its alright but its better off on the zip of a bag!
